document.masterDocTitle: An annotated checklist of the chondrichthyans of Papua New Guinea

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: An annotated checklist of the chondrichthyans of Papua New Guinea

subSubSection.paragraph:
Platypodon coatesi Whitley, 1939b: 234
, Fig. 7. Holotype: QM I.6226. Type locality: Hinchinbrook Passage, Queensland, Australia.

Local synonymy:
Carcharias menisorrah—
Ogilby, 1888: 2 (Port Moresby); Ogilby, 1889: 1768 (Port Moresby).
Eulamia menisorrah
— Fowler, 1928 : 20 (Port Moresby); Fowler 1934 : 385 (Port Moresby); Fowler, 1941 : 161 (Port Moresby).
Carcharhinus dussumieri—
Munro, 1958: 112 (Ningin Island, New Ireland); Munro, 1967: 10, pl. 1, fig. 12? (New Guinea); Filewood, 1973 : 7 (PNG?); Kailola, 1987 : 14 (PNG).
Carcharhinus menisorrah—
Munro, 1958: 112 (southern New Guinea); Munro, 1967: 10, pl. 1, fig. 11 (New Guinea); Filewood, 1973 : 7 (PNG).
Carcharhinus menisorrah
(=
coatesi
) Filewood, 1973 : 7 (PNG).
Carcharhinus sealei—
Compagno, 1984 : 498 (PNG); Kailola, 1987 : 17 (PNG).
Carcharhinus coeatesi—
White et al. , 2018
: 140, figs (PNG).

PNG

Remarks: First reported from Port Moresby by Ogilby (1888) as
Carcharias menisorrah .
Previously considered to be a synonym of
Carcharhinus dussumieri (Valenciennes in Müller & Henle, 1839)
; recently resurrected as a valid species for the Australian and New Guinea members of the
dussumieri -sealei
complex. Very common in the Gulf of Papua.
